ngiemboon: Melekísèndeg ŋwɛ́ laa fùɔ pʉ̀a Salɛm, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ nùŋepwɔʼ we Ssé, é Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Ábalaham laa lyɛ̌ʼ gie à la gʉa ncù, ńtó ńdÿɔ́ʼ mefùɔ tà é gyɔ́ɔn, ńjÿó wɔ́b, ńne ḿbiŋe nzèm, Melekiséndeg gʉa ńzáʼa yé, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na yé.
en: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of God Most High, met Abraham and blessed him as he returned from defeating the kings,

ngiemboon: Ábalaham gabte shúm sie à lɔ̌g fó ncù nzsè legém, ńnáa tàʼ nzsè né yé. Lezíŋ Melekiséndeg zɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Fùɔ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ», à gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pʉ̀a Salɛm púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ «fùɔ mbʉ́lè.»
en: and Abraham gave him a tenth of everything. First, his name means king of righteousness, then also, king of Salem, meaning king of peace.

ngiemboon: Mé té tá pà Melekiséndeg zsé. Mé té má we zsé, ńké te zsé tsìŋendá gie á fóo mǒ wɔ́, mé té tóo tsɔ́ jʉʼ tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé, ńjúʼ mé gɔɔn páʼ mé la zyé yé púʼu wɔ́, ńké te júʼ mé gɔɔn páʼ à la kwé púʼu wɔ́. Á gwɔ́ púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ páʼ Míŋ Ssé, Á nue aa nùŋepwɔʼ gẅie à ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: Without father, mother, or genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but resembling the Son of God,   he remains a priest forever.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá páʼ Melekiséndeg lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ máa nyìŋ púʼu, á yé gẅie Ábalaham, á mángʉanjʉʼ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, la lɔg shúm éfó ncù, ńgabte nzsè legém, ńnáa tàʼ nzsè mbwó yé.
en: Now consider how great this man was: even Abraham the patriarch   gave a tenth of the plunder to him.

ngiemboon: Lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê zɛ́te mbwó panuŋepwɔʼ pie é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ Lěvî ngie, pɔ́ zɛ́te mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie pɔ́ gʉa na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie pɔ́ gẅiin, ńgabte nzsè legém, ńnáa tàʼ nzsè mbwó pɔ́b panuŋepwɔʼ, ńzɛ́te púʼu, á mbwó mefɛ̌ pɔ́b, tá pɔ́ metsèm pú fóo pɔ́ na ngẅɛ̀ Ábalaham.
en: The sons of Levi who receive the priestly office have a command according to the law to collect a tenth from the people    #— #that is, from their brothers and sisters #— #though they have also descended from Abraham.

ngiemboon: Melekiséndeg la te nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Lěvî wɔ́, táʼ, Ábalaham gabte shúm sé nzsè legém, ńnáa tàʼ nzsè né yé, á kẅé, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na yé gẅie e Ssé la kaʼa mmó mbwó yé.
en: But one without this   lineage collected a tenth from Abraham and blessed the one who had the promises.  # 7:6 Gn 14:19; Rm 4:13

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn ńzsé mboŋó ngie nyìŋ gẅie à néŋe mbʉ́lè, à cʉa nyìŋ gẅie à kẅé mbʉ́lè.
en: Without a doubt, the inferior is blessed by the superior.

ngiemboon: Panuŋepwɔʼ pie é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ Lěvî, é pie é kẅé tàʼ nzsè na shúm nzsè legém, pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a pie é néŋe ńkwéte. Tá ńgʉa na Melekiséndeg gẅie à la kẅé tàʼ nzsè á na shúm nzsè legém, aa nyìŋ gẅie aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, páʼ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ne shwóŋo wégè púʼu.
en: In the one case, men who will die receive a tenth, but in the other case, Scripture testifies that he lives.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pege gɔɔn ngie epʉ̀a Lěvî pie é kẅé tàʼ nzsè, á na shúm nzsè legém, la ná yɔ́b tàʼ nzsè á na nzsè legém mbwó Melekiséndeg, púʼu ńcʉa na Ábalaham.
en: And in a sense Levi himself, who receives a tenth, has paid a tenth through Abraham,

ngiemboon: Á nue á laa lyɛ̌ʼ gie Melekiséndeg la gʉa ńzáʼa Ábalaham, Lěvî gwɔ́ yé ssé, ńcʉa na páʼ à laa lepfòm Ábalaham gẅie aa ngàb ngẅɛ̀ wɔb.
en: for he was still within his ancestor   when Melchizedek met him.

ngiemboon: Lepʉ̌ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ zɛ́te ngie mé lɔg pɔ́ pʉ̀a Lěvî ńgÿo panuŋepwɔʼ. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ panuŋepwɔʼ á na ntí gie Áloŋ la gwɔ́ yé púʼu. Ammó laa péʼe á té zága na yɔb ntí lenùŋe pwɔʼ wɔ́, mbà lenyě wɔ́b, ńcʉ́ʼ faʼa tsɔ̌ nùŋepwɔʼ pɔ́ na ntí ye Melekiséndeg lɔ̌ɔn é ge kẅéte na kɔ́?
en: Now if perfection came through the Levitical priesthood (for on the basis of it the people received the law  ), what further need was there for another priest to appear, said to be according to the order of Melchizedek and not according to the order of Aaron?  # 7:11 Heb 7:17; 10:1

ngiemboon: Ntí ye lélɔg ńtsɔ́ʼ panuŋepwɔʼ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńkúbe, mbà lepʉ̌ gẅiin légíŋ ńkúbe yé.
en: For when there is a change of the priesthood, there must be a change of law as well.

ngiemboon: Mé gɔɔn mɔɔn menò páʼɔɔn, ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege. Á yé gẅie à fóo na tsɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ yendyɛ̀ʼɛ, é gie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa fó mǒ éfaʼa fàʼ á jʉʼ gie mé nuŋe pwɔʼ wó wɔ́.
en: For the one these things are spoken about belonged to a different tribe. No one from it has served at the altar.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm zɔɔn ńne ńzsé ngie, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege fóo na ngẅɛ̀ Yúndà, é ngẅɛ̀ gie Mǒonsê la te kíme nò mǒ, á fʉ̀ʼ gie á lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn nò ńtí panuŋepwɔʼ wɔ́.
en: Now it is evident that our Lord came from Judah,   and Moses said nothing about that tribe concerning priests.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie mé ge fó mǒ é nyɛte júʼu nò gie mé ne ńdáʼ ńzye légɔɔn, áa páʼ wetsɔ̌ nùŋepwɔʼ gẅie à la kẅɛ, aa na ntí ye Melekiséndeg.
en: And this becomes clearer if another priest like Melchizedek appears,

ngiemboon: À te gwaa gwɔ́ nùŋepwɔʼ páʼɔɔn, á fóo na tsɔ́ lepʉ̌ sie mé la záb ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ giŋe mǒ wɔ́. Á fóo pɔ́ na metʉ̀ mie ée na we legwɔ́ wó. Awɛ̌ legwɔ́ wó, á gwɔ́ we temì,
en: who did not become a priest based on a legal regulation about physical   descent but based on the power of an indestructible life.

ngiemboon: mbà mé la ŋweʼe nò ńtíi yé, á gwɔ́ ngie: «Ɔɔ nùŋepwɔʼ gẅie à ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌ ngùʼ nkɔ́ɔn né nkɔ́ɔn, á na ntí ye Melekiséndeg.»
en: For it has been testified:

ngiemboon: Mé lɔg púʼu, ḿvɔg ńtsɛ́ɛ nzẅìŋe nzsè gẅie mé la vɔg ńtsẅi ngie mé giŋe mǒ, á nue ammó la zága na yɛ̌ nzsè, é piŋ te kẅéte.
en: So the previous command is annulled because it was weak and unprofitable

ngiemboon: Púʼu, á nue lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê la te gÿo tà tsɔ́ mmó kuʼu na ntí gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́. Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbà Ssé la tsɔ́ʼ nzsè sẅé, enkwaŋá wégè néŋe fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńcʉ́ʼ ńtyé pɔ́ mǒ. Ee mbòŋ ńcʉa yetsɔ́, á nue pege pfó mǒ ńgʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: (for the law perfected   nothing), but a better hope is introduced, through which we draw near to God.  # 7:19 Heb 4:16; 6:18

ngiemboon: E gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ, á nue e Ssé la gwaa tÿɔ́gɔ nùŋepwɔʼ welÿo we yɛ̌ nzsè, ńgɔɔn nò tà ńkʉa. Panuŋepwɔʼ pe melÿò la gwaa kẅɛɛ na ngẅɛ̀ Lěvî, e Ssé te gɔɔn nò tà ńkʉa wɔ́,
en: None of this happened without an oath. For others became priests without an oath,

ngiemboon: tá á gʉa na Yěsô, á gwaa cʉ́ʼʉ nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò, e Ssé gɔɔn nò né yé tà ńkʉa ngie:
en: but he became a priest with an oath made by the one who said to him:

ngiemboon: Á la fó mǒ, e Ssé lɔgɔ Yěsô ńcwóŋ lezyɛ̌ na yɔɔn kʉ̀a yesẅé gie áa mbòŋ ńcʉa yetsɔ́.
en: Because of this oath, Jesus has also become the guarantee of a better covenant.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mǒ gwɔ́ ngie: Panuŋepwɔʼ pe ngẅɛ̀ Lěvî la gwaa gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn, á nue legwé lɔ̌ɔn ńtɔʼɔ wɔ́b léké ńdáʼa faʼa fàʼ yɔ́b faʼ.
en: Now many have become Levitical priests, since they are prevented by death from remaining in office.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa na Yěsô, mbà ayé faʼa nùŋepwɔʼ té gie ngwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ faʼ wɔ́, á nue yé Yěsô ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, é ngùʼ nkɔ́ɔn né nkɔ́ɔn.
en: But because he remains forever, he holds his priesthood permanently.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gíŋ ńgÿo, á kuʼu légÿo epʉ̀a pie é ne ńdɔgɔ yé ńtsóte nnɛ́ né lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, pɔ́ tsẅɛ́ ndàʼndàʼ. Púʼu, á nue yé Yěsô aa ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, páʼ à ge sẅíŋte Ssé na twó yɔ́b.
en: Therefore, he is able to save completely those who come to God through him, since he always lives to intercede   for them.

ngiemboon: À lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò gẅie á la ne ńzɛ́te mbwó pege. Aa kwàʼ Míŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ mbǔʼ na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńgwɔ́ té tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ na yé, pâ pagÿo menò tepòŋ té tsɔ́ nò tem, mbà Ssé la néŋe yé tàa tÿǒ tà tsɔ́ mmó té gíŋ ńtɔ́gɔ yé ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ wɔ́.
en: For this is the kind of high priest we need: holy, innocent, undefiled, separated from sinners, and exalted above the heavens.

ngiemboon: À te páʼ petsɔ́ panuŋepwɔʼ pe melÿò pie é la gẅiin lénuŋe pwɔʼ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm wɔ́. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ḿvɔgɔ ńnuŋe pwɔʼ na mɔ́b menò tepòŋ, tá ḿbiŋe ńnuŋe pwɔʼ na menò tepòŋ mè petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. À la nuŋe wé pwɔʼ pɔ́ tàʼ legʉ̀a, á gwɔ́ páʼ à la náa twó mbùm yé na tÿǒnkǐ, á kuʼ púʼu.
en: He doesn’t need to offer sacrifices every day, as high priests do #— #first for their own sins, then for those of the people. He did this once for all time when he offered himself.

ngiemboon: Lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê zɔɔn ńgÿo mé lɔgɔ nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie à kʉ́a kʉ̌a páʼ petsɔ́, ńgÿo nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò. Táʼ, anò gie Ssé la záb lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê ḿbiŋ ńtáa ńgɔɔn tà ńkʉa, á la gÿo, á lɔgɔ Míŋ we gẅie à leen ńdáʼ ńkuʼu na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie yé Ssé la ne ńzẅíʼte yé mǒ, ńdɔg ńgÿo nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò na ngùʼ nkɔ́ɔn né nkɔ́ɔn.
en: For the law appoints as high priests men who are weak, but the promise of the oath, which came after the law, appoints a Son,   who has been perfected  # 7:28 Php 3:12; Heb 10:14; 11:40 forever.
